text:
e="preserve">Michael Yeung Ming-cheung (, 1 December 1945 – 3 January 2019) was a Chinese Roman Catholic official. He was the 9th Bishop of Hong Kong from 2017 until his death in 2019. He was born in Shanghai, China. On 11 July 2014, Pope Francis appointed him Titular Bishop of Mons in Numidia and named him one of three Auxiliary Bishops of Hong Kong.
Yeung died of liver failure caused by cirrhosis in Hong Kong on 3 January 2019 at the age of 73.
